question: Who among the following was Independent India's early advocate of free-market liberalism and also a critique of Nehru's planning policy?
explanation: B.R. Shenoy was an influential early advocate of free market liberalism. He warned about dependence on deficit financing in the second five year planning. Shenoy was proved right when India faced an external payments crisis a year after the plan period began. He was also critical of the Nehru governmentâ€™s penchant for import substitution.
